column4: so, mojo: you don't actually use your computer for anything, do you?
cos if you did, switching distros that often would be extremly disruptive....
i have a CD here... when mounting it in ubuntu i don't see all the files
any idea why?
yes
you do
i have a CD here... when mounting it in ubuntu i don't see all the files. both in nautilus and via a shell
in windows i can see all the files
is ubuntu trying to read the wrong file system or something?
youcan select to see hidden files and folders..
but wouldn't they show up using 'ls' if they were hidden?
a SDK
there is supposed to be 3 folders and an install script.
i can see some of the files, but they're not in their folders; they just appear to be in the root
bizarre
how did you untar the file
it came as an iso, which i burnt to a cd
mounting the iso as a virtual cd has the same effect
where i can't see all the files
so i'm wondering if there is something wrong with the iso... yet that cd looks as it should in windows
Did yhey offer an md5 checksum to test your cd/iso
